text: I know this is off topic but hope it can find its way to the product team (please share better channels for future feedback). I love the UI in HubSpot, but the import process requires so much mouse movement I always feel hesitant to start a new import.

I've got search working. In the default module, this boolean is available, but I didn't know how to make it work when calling it in hubl. I was trying to set it like other default booleans like `no-wrapper=True` , but for some reason it needs to be called like `include_search_button="true"`. This makes no sense to me and I hope HubSpot will normalize the way booleans are addressed in code.
Yeah, this should really be done by moving to the next page when you make the selection and providing a back button if you make a mistake.
does anyone know if it is possible to point a subdomain to HubSpot and then redirect it to one landing page. Or can you only have one domain per account?
that ui is pretty terrible
You can add a subdomain as a redirected domain and then redirect it to a specific page using the URL Redirects tool
Thank you very much Shamash. I was unaware of this ability to point a cname to HubSpot. Will give this a try.
Is there a javascript function to trigger the embed form popup so it opens on page load instead of waiting 7 seconds?
huh yeah that is odd... and i now finally understand what you were trying to do... also weird the button is off by default you think it would be the other way around

Hi all, sorry if this is the wrong channel. please redirect me if you need to. I'm having a baffling problem where call-to-actions are not showing up in *rich text editors* within a *landing page template*. however, they show up in page preview or when the page is published. Chrome dev tools is showing that the src of the CTA image gets changed to a 1px transparent gif when in editing mode. does anyone have any ideas? Working on Chrome 79.0 on a Mac OS 10.14
I know that HubSpot can do slide-in / popup forms, but what about sliding in a module that is NOT a form? Or one on exit intent?
Hi all! anyone using Lucky Orange to track traffic?
Are there some general guidelines about issues that could be preventing CSS from combining?
I’m getting combined CSS loading on Firefox, but not on Chrome
combining is server side isnt it? sounds like maybe it’s a CDN thing?
To make things more interesting… it actually is combining.  I’m getting uncombined CSS files when I’m logged in (which I don’t hate because debugging is nice)

It is server side, but I’ve run into situations where I have an error in my CSS somewhere that prevents the files from combining.

Similar with JS errors (or even warnings) preventing JS files from minifying
Has someone here uses this tool and can recommend it? <https://accessibe.com/>

My personal opinion - do not expect any “one-stop-shop” plugin to ever “solve” accessibility for your site. They may help, and may be a good short term solution in a larger effort.

They do help users solve some issues for themselves but really you are offloading your work to your customers, and the resulting a11y experience may not be better as a result.

the primary concern I would have is that any of these solutions do not know the UI/UX you have implemented and how and why it works the way it works.

Example an accordion - if you didn’t build it in an accessible way. There’s likely no reason this type of tool should be trusted to “fix” it for you, because the way you built the accordion is possibly unique to your site.

This is not a comprehensive guide, but an okay starting point to launch off from: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/making-your-content-accessible>

See resources at the bottom
wow that page is an information overload!

<#CSFGKSHT7|themes> is the channel for it, im guessing

+100 on <@U7SL518D6>’s above comment. I’m very wary and skeptical of these pay-to-play widgets, and I think you’ll be able to make much more meaningful progress by doing some accessibility basics like having good contrast, semantic/‘nested’ headers, and contextual links.
<@UBT0AHWLD> I’m excited that you’re thinking of accessibility for your site! :hamsterdance:
<@UA5DFM7CK> feel free to post it here or <#CSFGKSHT7|themes> and I will make sure eyes get on the issues! Thanks for the feedback
